action.action-desc: Ms. Schrier (for herself and Ms. Bonamici) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to require a study of the time and duration of school lunch periods, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Healthy Meal Time Act of 2022.
The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1769) is amended by inserting after section 26 the following:

paragraph.text: not later than 1 year after the date on which funds are first appropriated under subsection (c), enter into an agreement with an independent, nonpartisan, science-based research organization to carry out a study on the time lunches are served, recess is offered, and the duration of lunch periods at schools participating in the school lunch program under this Act; and

not later than 4 years after the date on which funds are first appropriated under subsection (c), publish on the publicly available website of the Department a report that includes the findings of the study required under paragraph (1).

subsection.header: Development and dissemination of best practices

paragraph.text: not later than 1 year after the date on which the report required under subsection (a)(2) is published, in coordination with the Secretary of Education, establish a task force to—

subparagraph.text: review other research relating to the time lunches are served, recess is offered, and the duration of lunch periods in schools; and

develop best practices with respect to the time lunches are served, recess is offered, and the duration of lunch periods in schools to ensure student health, including appropriate nutritional intake; and

paragraph.text: not later than 2 years after the date on which the report required under subsection (a)(2) is published—

subparagraph.text: review the best practices developed under paragraph (1)(C); and
issue guidance with respect to such best practices to schools participating in the school lunch program under this Act.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $1,000,000 for fiscal year 2023, to remain available until expended.
